Creator: ts17xop
Description:
# After selecting the datasets_rec folder it took a while until the pop up appeared "Upload files to this Site?"
 # After pressing Upload, the next page(with upload progress) was not shown for a long time. I had to reload the page and repeat the upload
 # Uploading time seems to be increasing esp when switching to a new tab (could be that the browser (Chrome) is down prioritizing it when in the background?). Makes a weird user experience, because keeping the tab open for potentially a few hours of upload is not realistic
 # Typo? Uploading instead of Uploaded:
!https://confluence.navvis.com/download/attachments/48042995/Screenshot%202019-08-29%20at%2017.33.14.png?version=1&modificationDate=1567092809527&api=v2|height=250!
 # For some reason in the processed data, the same dataset appeared twice (although there was only 1 processing task): !https://confluence.navvis.com/download/attachments/48042995/Screenshot%202019-08-30%20at%2010.36.39.png?version=1&modificationDate=1567154315022&api=v2|height=250!!https://confluence.navvis.com/download/attachments/48042995/Screenshot%202019-08-30%20at%2010.36.55.png?version=1&modificationDate=1567154314752&api=v2|height=224!

Summary: Upload stuck after computer went to sleep
Creator: ml16cav
Description:
h2. Description: I started upload of 4 datasets a day ago. My assumption is that the upload crashed when the computer went to sleep but there is no error and it looks like it's still uploading. Not sure what's happening in the background but it's already for a day like that. Check the pic for info :)
h2. Expected result: There is an error if the upload crashes
h2. Steps To Reproduce:
 # Put data to upload
 # Let computer go to sleep

h2. Environment:
h3. OS, Browser: Google Chrome
h3. Instance URL: [http://test-test-cloud-processing-18:8080/iv/]

Creator: ml16cav
Description:
# create a task before even being able to upload data. Then datasets can be sorted in a project like directory
 # Start processing directly from the upload page
 # Copy to dataset management? Why do we have this? Can we store web processed data directly there to avoid a need to copy anything. 
 #  Could all the processing be at the same page? we have menu for data processing, but then maps and navgraph under dataset management. It would be nice to have it all together. 
 # My new instance contained preexisting SiteModel and bundle file in the dataset management. - Was someone playing with it or we want to have predefined examples of the data?
Comment:
03/Sep/19 4:45 PM;lc17zek;#3 - For cost reasons we want to keep the to be and processed data separately from the instance size

#5 - Might be because we are using the NVC build - let me look into it

Summary: Processing progression is not shown in the percentage bar
Creator: nl18pef
Description: During processing, the progress bar is not moving during processing.

Creator: ml16cav
Description:
I don't know what kind of instance this is but processing of the dataset of a size 1.4 GB took around 1 hour (post and web). 

On the local machine (128 GB RAM) it took 34 min. 

I'd expect Cloud to be faster than my local machine. 

Linked as well to: 
 # CTP-118
Comment:
03/Sep/19 4:19 PM;mk19wep;To be investigated it might be fixed with https://jira.navvis.com/browse/MAP-4122 

[~pm18pil]
Comment_19:
03/Sep/19 4:19 PM;lc17zek;We should get an outline of each section of the time pipeline and what resources are used.

 

Also test with the Pano rendering fix

Creator: ml16cav
Description:
I'd put few UI changes to improve user experience

 
 # When the data was uploaded (after the progress bar went crazy) there was no feedback that it's actually uploaded. I would put a prompt of make it more visible within the dataset
 # I would expect to start data processing directly from the uploading page rather than going to a different menu 
 # It would be nice to have a visual sign that the processing is running. It took 6 min to annoy me that the progress bar is still at 0% - even that usual loading circle would be an indicator that something is moving :D
 # After processing of one dataset, I had 2 in the processed datasets page. They are named the same and I don't understand what they are (pic attached)
 # Instance shows me 8 licensed users in instance key settings - what kind of Cloud package is that :D?

Creator: ml16cav
Description:
Just a small point. If i don't press on the data upload prompt when i start the new instance, and i want to navigate to data upload through the menu bar, naming is a bit misguiding. 

I wouldn't necessarily go under uploaded data to find a place to upload new. 

In my opinion, it should be named "upload data" and there could be a history of uploaded ones. Something like downloading from browser. You press download but you have the overview of lately downloaded data.
